title: Call Credit Spreads for Bearish/Neutral Markets

source.video: Credit Spreads | Call Credit Spreads | Call Credit

summary: Call credit spreads complement put credit spreads for market-neutral income generation when stocks are overbought

context.current_strategy: PUT credit spreads (bullish bias) on SPY/IWM
context.solution: Add CALL credit spreads for overbought/peaked stocks

key_lessons.topic: When to Use Call Credit Spreads
details: Stock has rallied aggressively and appears to be peaking
Bearish or neutral outlook on underlying
Ideal for generating passive income on overextended stocks
Bollinger Bands: Enter when stock is near/above upper band (20-day, 2 std dev)
RSI overbought conditions (>70) suggest reversal or sideways movement
Use technical resistance levels as buffer for strike selection
Expiration: 60+ DTE (2 months) for passive income and higher premiums
Spread Width: $300-$500 (narrow spreads have poor liquidity)
10% max capital per trade (we use stricter 5%)
Balance call AND put credit spreads for market neutrality
If challenged: Roll up and out (higher strike, further expiration)
Accept losses objectively - 1 in 20 losing trades is normal for professionals

integration.put_spreads: Bullish bias, use at support levels, roll down and out
integration.call_spreads: Bearish/neutral bias, use at resistance levels, roll up and out
integration.combined_strategy: Market neutral income generation regardless of direction

modifications_for_5k_account: Use 45-60 DTE (balance premium vs time risk)
Target 0.15-0.20 delta for higher win rate
prevention: Only enter when technical signals align (overbought, near resistance)
Allow 60+ DTE for time to work in your favor
Roll up and out if challenged, don't panic close
Diversify with both call AND put spreads
